title: With the uptick in Covid-19, why would people still deny the value of masks? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is not so much masks have no value. But they have limited value. UNLESS they are N95 orN99 masks. Because the blue surgical masks were designed to stop doctors from sneezing into a patient they have open on an operating table. Or the common cotton masks with graphics and logos, etc on them… like the “Sham-Wow” TV commercial for their sham-wow washable masks they accurately claim “are 100% effective at stopping mold and bacteria and allergy causing pollens,” But DO NOT claim they stop a single virus particle IE: SARS -CoV-2 Nothing but N95 or better stops covid. And only because for a time the “party line” was that most virus were in sneezed “spit droplets” that Sham-wow and the like, DO stop 100% of the time, instead what is seemly proving to be the case the majority of the time: “random loose virus floating in the air for 15 minutes to 4 hours that obviously usually drift a lot further than 6 feet and the CDC’s first statements plainly stating n95 or better were required… …popular media and even government public service announcements showed “Sham-wow” type masks implying they are all that the public needed if they couldn’t maintain the now being seen as “6 feet *NOT* safe distancing” Because at 140 Billionth of a meter, it takes *1,000 covid lined up side by side* to be close to the width of a single human hair (at 180 Millionth of a meter). *That’s width not length of a human hair.* The Size of SARS-CoV-2 Compared to Other Things “between 60 nanometers (nm) to a maximum diameter of 140 nanometers (nm).” “Human hair widths are generally between 17 and 180 micrometers,… ” Denny R's Homepage. Denny & Gayle Rossbach. Palmdale, CA.
